metadata.name: Inline Python Execution - Spawn Shell Via OS System Library
metadata.comment: Detects execution of inline Python code via the "-c" in order to call the "system" function from the "os" library, and spawn a shell.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/python')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/python2')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/python3'))) AND (contains(lower(process.name), lower('/python2.')) OR contains(lower(process.name), lower('/python3.'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -c ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('os.system(')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/bash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/dash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/fish')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/sh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/zsh'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of inline Python code via the "-c" in order to call the "system" function from the "os" library, and spawn a shell.
